reviewText:
A bad server browser, poor audio and visual effects design, a limited amount of maps and imbalanced melee weapons bring down would could have been a well-off third person shooter.

The server browser button opens up a spreadsheet in a window in the steam overlay and from it you can see the IP, player count, and gamemode of each server but you CANNOT see the ping. I don't know of a solid multiplayer title that does display ping times in the server browser. Even in game I assume the ping amount that is seen in the scoreboard is false. I have 20-28 ping yet am rubberbanding and seeing delays in item pickups, delays in player deaths, and am not seeing all bounce minigun projectiles appear while firing is how I assume the ping number is false.

The audio fades out when you are at low health and even before then, many weapons sound as powerful as water pistols, like the speed shotgun. The audio fade makes it very difficult to hear incoming fire, and does not do a good job of discerning the already blocky(literrally) weapons one another. The visual choices of what should be displayed in the HUD(hint - a healthbar, which isn't) don't really make sense. Your equipment recharge icon is very small so it's difficult to tell when exactly it will be ready again. Instead of a health bar you can see how much health you have by purely guessing from how yellow and bright your body is. Seriously, there is not way of understanding exactly how much health you have at any one time. This game more than many others should show your health amounts, especially when there are weapon upgrades that do more damage the more they are upgraded, and when armor pieces either increase damage done to you or increase maximum health or increase resistances to certain damage types. If it was a game with fixed health amounts and fixed weapon damages then I could understand, I wouldn't need to know the exact amount of hp to see if I am winning a fight or not, or whether or not I can peak one more time for an extra shotgun blast for a kill, knowing I can trade a hit and still win. In this game you just guess. In addition to those poor visual design choices there are the effects. Upgrading your katanas will allow you to have fire burst in a significant area around you, many times making sight impossible past the fire. having very bright and obnoxious weapon effects on characters makes trying to tell the already innacurate hp to brightness system even worse.

A perfect example of bad sound design is the fact that there is a hitmarker placed near your crosshair everytime you land a hit and the option of turning on hit sounds. Even the designer(s) knew it was bad.

But all of this is still bearable, despite the sounds, server browser, visuals, the unlock system being quite a pain to grind through and the maps being very few, the game itself is very fun... until someone uses the katanas.

The katanas, any type really, are the strongest weapon in the game and are very overpowered. They kill faster than any weapon in the game, have a large hit radius(even vertically) and do not require any ammunition or aim, as they will turn you in the direction of your opponent on every attack. The only way to kill a player with a katana is to kill them before they get close to you which is very difficult when you can see around corners with the 3rd person camera, can sprint and can use the alternate fire button to instantly close the distance on an opponent. Coupled with the fact that many weapons have a very substantial time to kill, unless you are in a very open area and the katana-wielder is far away, they will get to you 4/5 times and at that point you will not get away. They are simply ridiculous and most TDM matches come down to how many people are using katanas on each time. Every other weapon in the game requires you to put the enemy in your crosshair while trying to get yourself out of theirs. The katanas don't care and sword fights boil down to 2 players spamming attacks wildly and uncontrollably in an attempt to kill the other player. Due to the fact katanas can close gaps instantly means they are massively overpowered and have no direct counter other than using certain items to evade and run away from the sword.
voteText: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR:Review of beta: Take everything with a grain of salt. Everything is subject to change. Serious balance changes are needed.

Minimum is a game that i've been anticipating for a while, it's a neat concept, it has unique gameplay, and the gameplay is fluid.
It has tons of problems though.
As of right now, melee is absolutely overpowered, it's hard to get a single match without some spaz running around chopping everybody on the other team to pieces.
Speaking of teams, the matchmaking & balancing is also really terrible. Numerous times i've been on the receiving end of a 1v4, or worse. There is absolutely nothing that can be done if you're by yourself, unless everyone on the other team is braindead or afk, or if you're going hard with melee & speed.
Tons of balance changes need to be made, an example would be with the different armors. Most of the armor sets are hardly viable at all, and the rest are incredibly situational...Except for the berzerker set. Because you can't change your armor once you've applied it, there is never any reason to go with anything other than the berzerker set. It scales the best with levels, and is usable with ANY weapon. Don't get me wrong, some pieces like the Icarus chestplate are useful, it gives a nice increase to melee protection. The only problem is that it's as previously mentioned, very situational, and the movement penalty cancels itself out when you can't get away from a melee user.

Sorry for the wall of text, and hopefully this game's future will be brighter.

reviewText:
Minimum made a good progress during the months of Early Access. The developers added new maps, cool things to craft and new game modes. The overall multiplayer stability is much better now. Matchmaking is not perfected yet - there is no server browser and no lobby system and sometimes, I have to wait more than 2 minutes to join a game. But this is manageable compared to the gameplay experience you get.

Titan mode is the heart of the game, it combines old school deathmatch and MOBA focused gameplay, but you can also play classic team deathmatch or the cooperative horde mode against the AI. The gameplay is fast and dynamic, you have to put some time into the game to get more experienced. Your weapon gets more effective with every kill, so there is definitely some snowball effect here, but the better is the feeling when you get your first killstreak. Don't underestimate the importance of crafting and customization. Finding the right set of armor can be the key to dominate a match.

Last but not least, the minimalist art style makes the game fresh and unique. You won't find many textures but the effects are great, the sound is powerful and the maps are very well designed.

reviewText:
So how is it that this game is supposed to be fun?

In the few matches I played, there seemed to be little use in creating a strategy that would work against more seasoned players. This was compounded by the fact that swords seem to be overpowered (faster movement + more damage). Add it all up and what I was left with feeling was frustration that there seems to be little to no hope at 'getting better' since you only live a few seconds, die, and all that non-learning-curve losing just enables an already-knowledgable team to get even farther ahead in the match.

It's basically a snowball effect of initial loss creates greater loss, while people who have seemingly been playing longer exploit that to it's fullest. Which I suppose is fine for them...but I'd be worried by how far the community can grow, if the only incentive for playing is being crushed regularly, and thoroughly.

Which is a shame too - I bought a pack of this thinking it would be something fun for my friends and I to play. Now I will urge them against an installation altogether. I'm actually the one out of us who has some patience for punishing gameplay, and even I think the amount of overkill you can experience strangles any chance of learning and becoming better out of a losing match.

It's unfortunate, because mechanically Minimum is interesting. It reminds me of Monday Night Combat, except skills and classes are replaced by gear, and there's an emphasis on escorting Titans (at least in that mode) and improving them that, in theory, means different people could play different roles.

As it is though, the game is woefully imbalanced towards swords, and further punishing a losing team to the point of discouragement, than learning through loss. I'd rather take a more balanced experience like TF2 over this as it is.

reviewText:
Poorly designed game overall. At first it was kinda fun when we had 3 of us on a team but then one guy got on the other team showing just how bad the game is.

The shotgun speeds you up the more you kill and you pair that with berserker armour(base armour) and you run very fast with even more damage. A lot of levels also work perfectly to just go around with the shotgun and kill everyone. We all essentially just switched to the shotgun at the end because it was the only way to truely keep up.

The titan fighting seems cool but it's rather basic and they just seem to be giant sponges with little indication of how to kill them. The defenses seem rather medicore to actually kill it and if your team(or in most cases bots) just give free kills to the enemy they will level up rapidly and causing the balance to go to them.

The game is flawed in design because you need actually balanced teams to make it work which as EVERY game can't seem to do balance.

I would rather go play COD: Advanced Warfare on PC which sucks almost as badly(still sucks).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Awesome game.. very quick and twitchy style which i dont mind too much tho been a long time since the old quake/UT days for me ;)

Games can become unfair very quickly however.. not to mention games can even start with unbalanced teams to begin with and carry on like that for quite a few rounds.. been plenty of games ive had with 1 side total rankings put together are 10 times higher then the other side..

the crafting system is interesting and upgrades to weapons and weapon leveling (not in game as of 11/5/14 beta test) along the way looks promising

and it brings the old LoL type gearing system to the FPS genre which is kind of cool ;) will see how it ends up..

The beta ive played had a couple of bugs.. one involving my entire team ending up not in a team which ment we could kill each other and the other team and confused things alot.. and i have seen it happen to single players aswell.. there are some odd graphical glitches too but im not sure if they are intended or not..

if you dont already have a beta key and would like to help out a stranger  use this link http://playminimum.com/♥♥♥♥♥♥♥abf3d96b1a
after a few people have used it ill get some items for release (Crafting mats at 5 referals.. and a weapon at 10)

reviewText: First off the graphics are stunning and still great at low settings. The gameplay is quite action packed and fun. TDM lets you just murder everyone, Titan allows you more space to roam and requires strategy to master, and Horde offers a unique man-hunt experience. Many people complain of weapon imbalances and while they are true to a certain extent I have not found a single weapon that cannot be countered one way or another. Yes, the glitches are there, but not adundant. It is definitely not refined, but what do you expect? It's in early access still.\n\nOverall I recommend the game, but you need to be patient with glitches and taking the time to obtain the weapons/armor you'll need to match your playstyle. Titan may not be for everyone, but even the TDM mode is fun. Balance is decent so long as you think reasonably and set up the proper counters.

reviewText:
Minimum is an mmotps set in a geometrical world with MOBA elements.

It's fun in its own way, and also unique.

It's MOBA Elements are: Temporary level up and armor.

It has 3 modes.
1. Titan Mode
2. Horde Mode
3. Team Deathmatch Mode

Titan mode: Kill creatures called creeps to power up your titan, titan will clash with enemy titan, if our titan win we defend our titan to destroy enemy core, if our titan lose we will try to stop enemy titan from destroying our core, victory is given to the team who destroyed the opposing core.

Horde Mode: 4 Players team up to fight dinosaurs, ninjas, astronauts, and samurais.

Team Deathmatch: Is Team Deathmatch.

Pros:
-Fun and satysfying
-Fast paced
-Has MOBA elements
-Male and Female model
-Geometrical

Cons:
-Creeps do nothing
-Titan Mode can get a bit repetitive
-Buggy and laggy if slow network
-Sometimes unfair
-Grind

Verdict: 8/10

Side Note: There is microtransactions in this game, and it's for skins.

++ I recommend buying this game if it's on sale. (Thank you for reading, if you are)

reviewText:
Went in to it not really expecting much... Boy was I pleasantly surprised.

The shooting mechanics are ridiculously tight... Tighter than some AAA releases.  The graphics are exactly as the title suggests, very minimalistic but the animations are ridiculously good.  The game seriously feels like a AAA game.  This is one of the best examples of how you execute minimalist style without it looking or feeling cheap.  (I'm lookin at you unmodded Minecraft.)

It's on sale at the time I'm writing this for $2.49...  You'd be a fool to pass up this opportunity.  That's cheaper than a junk burger from a fast food joint.  Do it.

reviewText:
This game is very, very, very, unfinished.

I came to this game because of titan mode that seemed like a interesting concept. While this is true, I cannot think of any other thing that this game did well. Half the game is missing, and due to this many elements of the game become useless after a point. The first issue is very apparent from the first match on wards, Lag. Both graphical and Network lag happens all the time. This game boasts a very low system requirements, This is untrue. I am at the high end of their Minimum-Suggested Requirements and the game was unplayable even at the lowest settings. I had to edit the ini files and turn off everything to actually get the game to work at a reasonable frame rate.

Beyond this the lag persists in it's other form. Network lag is very apparent during the match. Often I find my character “rubber banding” forward and back as I walk, and have even gotten teleported back a few feet because the server said I got caught on some geometry while the client didn't. This brings me to the next issue. The maps are littered with places you can get stuck or caught on. I can understand this is an alpha game but with no way as far as I can see to force respawn yourself this becomes a major issue. And the issue of respawning continues the issues as there is no way to change your build without suicide. This became another serious issue in Horde mode where if you click the wrong button(something that I did while trying to get to the build select menu), you are stuck in that build till everyone dies on the map or the round restarts(given you thew yourself on the enemy).

About a third of the time I  start up the game, and it crashes at some point within the first 30 seconds. The issues do not stop there. While in a party with my friends if we leave a match the party host has the restart the game in order to re invite us to play again. Many times I find the weapon description Missing as if it failed to load. Clicking on it multiple times eventually get's it to appear. The game Itself is just as broken. There are many parts of the game that don't seem to be balanced. The titans for instance seem to take random chunks out of each others health. The drop system is another concern, if you kill a player the loot from them drops at the corpse. This means both a teammate who had not fired a shot can steal all your items. This also means long range builds(such a sniping) becomes worthless as you don't get the items you need to upgrade. (you do get weapon upgrades through kills but no armor upgrades). Speaking of upgrades the crafting system in the game needs a MAJOR overhaul. Currently when you join a game your first job is not to see what you can do for the team but rather to open the crafting menu and start crafting up your armor. Armor crafting should be automatic.

This leaves me with the biggest issues I have with the game.
First is the Bots. In games if there are not enough players bots fills the slots. While this is somewhat ok, the bots are what like to call “cheating bots”. These  bots are low quality bots that cheat to compete with players. Many times I've turned corners to have bots waiting for me. Or going along when a bot decides that I should die and starting hitting me from across the map with perfect accuracy. This makes any element of stealth impossible. Secondly, the name Minimum, way too common of a word. You try to Google search anything related with this game and half the results are for other things. A Third big issue for me is the Controls. When I play I often throw a grenade on the ground quickly. However when I quickly move my mouse down the camera go up rather than down! Beyond this the third person is not done correctly as your character is often blocking your view and enemies can spot you while you can't see them. A first person mode is badly needed for this game. The final and biggest travesty is the fact shots keep disappearing! Many times I've shot, or thrown a grenade and the projectile either disappears in flight or just does not appear! In a shooter this a very bad problem one that should never be seen alpha or not.

To put it simple this game might be fun when it's done but in it's current state, do not buy. Wait till it's done.

reviewText:
Unoptimized piece of junk. Minimum had major potential but horrid execution.

-Upon exiting, the game occasionally freezes and must be force closed.
-The Katana is broken if the wielder can get close.
-Sprinting(Shift) and then dashing or doing any skill will force you to retoggle Sprint, despite holding down shift the whole time. This is extremely annoying in fast paced combat.
-The more kills, the more powerful, the harder to kill. Snowball OP.
-Lags constantly, even on good machines.
-Host disconnecting happens very often and everyone in the match is kicked.
-When creating a party, don't be surprised if party members aren't on the same team.

This game could have been tremendously better, yet it falls hard in the areas that matter most. 6/10

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game in its self is a really good take on the TPS genre combining Third Person Shooter elements with those youd most commonly see in MOBA's, It's has a unique simplistic art style like the one you'd see in Planetary Annihilation wich I gotta say I loved the maps are very good though I do wish they were bigger but you'd have to wait and see as there seem to be only 3 maps Titan Factory, Space station another wich I havent gotten the chance of playing yet. The game handles nicely I never felt confused by the controls it's very easy to get into and the armor crafting adds a layer of strategy to the game. Outside of matches progression wise you'll level up and earn rewards from that and completing matches wich can be put towards buying blueprints to then craft weapons. weapon crafting is instant there is no long wait timer and as someone who plays a game like Warframe alot this is a nice sight. This game holds alot of potential i can see it getting big I just hope either the devs advertise the game or a famous youtuber plays it so that the community can grow.

reviewText:
Gotta say, as soon as I saw this game I knew I was going to love it.  The simplistic graphics make for a great and visually pleasing experience even on low end PCs and fantastic on gaming rigs.

The combat is exceptionally fun, especially the swordfighting.  However currently the swords are the master race right now and the other weapons need a bit of love.

For the price, it's WELL worth the money.  There are micro transactions, but to be honest, even though they're really cheap, you take away part of the progression from yourself.  The gameplay is excellent enough that you'll want to earn every bit of gear.

9/10  -  Pretty effing good for en early access game

reviewText:
Bought it at 25% the original price. I haven't played this for very long, so I'm not gonna pretend that my review is worth any merit. So I'll just stick to objective observations at the time this review is written (30th Jan 2015,) and try to minimise MUH OPINIONS.

PROS:
Non-P2W. No amount of money can introduce advantage to anyone.
[opinion]Art style[/opinion]
Level design (balanced, varied, thematic, and [opinion]beautiful[/opinion])
Addictive
[opinion]FUNFUNFUN[/opinion]
GRAFFICS
CONS:
GRAFFICS (not very optimized as of yet)
No DX9 support. IMHO to appeal to a wider audience, they should support DX9. I can see the Titan mode being a popular e-sport because it's a simple game, yet there are so many elements to take care of when trying to complete the objective. Think DOTA. I don't play it, but I know that even people with the most minimal hardware can play and be very good at it.
Menu UI can definitely be improved (non-gameplay sections)
I'd like to add another point to the cons section, which is wonky netcode(?) but I'm not sure if it's justified. Currently I'm running on a mediocre-at-best hardware setup, with all the graphics feature set to the minimum, and I've seen reports of players with more than sufficient setups having only around 30-45fps. I'm pretty sure I didn't get more than 24fps, and it's really hard to hit anything. I've had myself and seen other people rubberband. Not sure if it's my network, my hardware, or the netcode. The ping never registers more than 65, and I play other games with similar ping just fine.

OVERALL it's a weak 6.5/10 atm, but the devs are still improving it so far. Don't be fooled by my score - I've had tons of fun in Minimum, and I [opinion]think you should[/opinion] too.

reviewText:
Minimum is an mmotps set in a geometrical world with MOBA elements.

It's fun in its own way, and also unique.

It's MOBA Elements are: Temporary level up and armor.

It has 3 modes.
1. Titan Mode
2. Horde Mode
3. Team Deathmatch Mode

Titan mode: Kill creatures called creeps to power up your titan, titan will clash with enemy titan, if our titan win we defend our titan to destroy enemy core, if our titan lose we will try to stop enemy titan from destroying our core, victory is given to the team who destroyed the opposing core.

Horde Mode: 4 Players team up to fight dinosaurs, ninjas, astronauts, and samurais.

Team Deathmatch: Is Team Deathmatch.

Pros:
-Fun and satysfying
-Fast paced
-Has MOBA elements
-Male and Female model
-Geometrical

Cons:
-Creeps do nothing
-Titan Mode can get a bit repetitive
-Buggy and laggy if slow network
-Sometimes unfair
-Grind

Verdict: 8/10

Side Note: There is microtransactions in this game, and it's for skins.

++ I recommend buying this game if it's on sale. (Thank you for reading, if you are)

reviewText:
Went in to it not really expecting much... Boy was I pleasantly surprised.

The shooting mechanics are ridiculously tight... Tighter than some AAA releases.  The graphics are exactly as the title suggests, very minimalistic but the animations are ridiculously good.  The game seriously feels like a AAA game.  This is one of the best examples of how you execute minimalist style without it looking or feeling cheap.  (I'm lookin at you unmodded Minecraft.)

It's on sale at the time I'm writing this for $2.49...  You'd be a fool to pass up this opportunity.  That's cheaper than a junk burger from a fast food joint.  Do it.

reviewText:
Just bought this game since it's out of early access and I have to say: I'm disappointed.

TL;DR: Nice game, unplayably buggy.

I hope that the problems I have with it will be removed in the future - on the other hand, that should have happened before release.
The game has really fun gameplay. It's a 3rd person moba that you can get into verys fast.
But in its current state, it is unplayable for my friends and me.
We built a party and joined a game. We started playing, but we instantly were in different teams.
Not being able to join in the same team breaks a moba, doesn't it?
A while after, we decided to build a new party and join a game again. This is where it got frustrating.
The menu UI went bananas, displayed random stuff, buttons that did nothing, processes could not be aborted, and, worst of all, we couldn't join any game. The few rounds I've played we're fun, but we couldn't play any more than that.
Additionally, lag spikes reset you up to a few meters, which pretty much breaks whatever you were just going to do.

We'll try again in a week or so, since the game itself wasn't aware that it was not early access anymore (smells like a missing update...), hoping that things will work out better.
Until then... nice idea, but pretty  unplayable.

reviewText: I feel like this could be a good game, but it just isn't. The game needs so much work to be really playable. The balance is horrible, the game creates a quick divide between the winning and losing team, and balance is quickly lost. Killstreaks are rewarded with more power, and power is lost upon death. This creates a team that has Tier 5 weapons against a team with Tier 1, and that divide rarely changes significantly. Many weapons are entirely surpassed by weapons bought or created later in the game, but matchmaking doesn't separate teams by level, and it is extremely common to find someone with Dual Master Fire Swords while you still have the basic Katana.

reviewText:
i have played for about 100 minutes, not much, but i plan to play many more.
To start off this is my favorite shooter game of all time, art style, gameplay, and overall ease make this game a blast. There are not a whole lot of weapons, but enough to keep it interesting and simple. Controls are easy
In terms of balance, this game lacks a little
There are obviously stronger weapons, these are usually bullet hound and any melee
Once maxed. (weapon will say maxed next to it under loadout) these weapons wreck shop. Also weapons get upgraded in game, but the bonus goes away when you die. Basically these weapons are a little too op, i have the maximized bullet hound, and let me tell you i can go through a game with an easy 40 kills. if not more (titan mode) so far i come into matches and either im really good, or really lucky. Since most people have 0 kills, the most kills ive seen from another player so far is 30. Its an easy game. However, i will say the melee weapons are slightly op, your tactical items (grenades and what not) are nice, but not very useful at times. Sniper rifles and shotguns are basically the bottom of the barrel.
So nice graphics, gameplay, feel, gamemodes, music.
Not so good balance and or community (they dont seem to do a very good job or i just get alot of easy matches)
Could be people play pvp and not titan, works for me
Overall an 8/10 game, really love it. Its worth 10 dollars but on sale its a really good deal. I usually buy weapons and stuff from the market so its easy and fun.

reviewText: This is a very fun 3rd person Shooter game with many fun ways to play. There are many different ways to play, like titan mode where you team has to protect your titan, and when you titan gets to the middle you teams titan and the opposing team's titan clash. When one team's titan wins the titan will proceed to the generator, but there are obstacles in the way, such as a wall and an enemy turret, your team must destroy the turret and help with the wall. After that the titan will proceed to the enemy generator. There is a TDM (Team Death Match) play style too. And there is the last play style, the horde mode. In the horde mode you will fight waves of dinosaurs robots and more. If you like fast paced action, this is your game.

reviewText: Minecraft + Halo Series + Teamfortress 2 = MINIMUM. This game is extreamly fun. The leveling system, currency concept, and weapon crafting is perfect and balanced. No pay-to-win here. Auto balancing tweaks and weapon nerfs must definitely be made. Overall, this is one of the best arena shooters i have played.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game in its self is a really good take on the TPS genre combining Third Person Shooter elements with those youd most commonly see in MOBA's, It's has a unique simplistic art style like the one you'd see in Planetary Annihilation wich I gotta say I loved the maps are very good though I do wish they were bigger but you'd have to wait and see as there seem to be only 3 maps Titan Factory, Space station another wich I havent gotten the chance of playing yet. The game handles nicely I never felt confused by the controls it's very easy to get into and the armor crafting adds a layer of strategy to the game. Outside of matches progression wise you'll level up and earn rewards from that and completing matches wich can be put towards buying blueprints to then craft weapons. weapon crafting is instant there is no long wait timer and as someone who plays a game like Warframe alot this is a nice sight. This game holds alot of potential i can see it getting big I just hope either the devs advertise the game or a famous youtuber plays it so that the community can grow.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Awesome game.. very quick and twitchy style which i dont mind too much tho been a long time since the old quake/UT days for me ;)

Games can become unfair very quickly however.. not to mention games can even start with unbalanced teams to begin with and carry on like that for quite a few rounds.. been plenty of games ive had with 1 side total rankings put together are 10 times higher then the other side..

the crafting system is interesting and upgrades to weapons and weapon leveling (not in game as of 11/5/14 beta test) along the way looks promising

and it brings the old LoL type gearing system to the FPS genre which is kind of cool ;) will see how it ends up..

The beta ive played had a couple of bugs.. one involving my entire team ending up not in a team which ment we could kill each other and the other team and confused things alot.. and i have seen it happen to single players aswell.. there are some odd graphical glitches too but im not sure if they are intended or not..

if you dont already have a beta key and would like to help out a stranger  use this link http://playminimum.com/♥♥♥♥♥♥♥abf3d96b1a
after a few people have used it ill get some items for release (Crafting mats at 5 referals.. and a weapon at 10)

reviewText:
i have played for about 100 minutes, not much, but i plan to play many more.
To start off this is my favorite shooter game of all time, art style, gameplay, and overall ease make this game a blast. There are not a whole lot of weapons, but enough to keep it interesting and simple. Controls are easy
In terms of balance, this game lacks a little
There are obviously stronger weapons, these are usually bullet hound and any melee
Once maxed. (weapon will say maxed next to it under loadout) these weapons wreck shop. Also weapons get upgraded in game, but the bonus goes away when you die. Basically these weapons are a little too op, i have the maximized bullet hound, and let me tell you i can go through a game with an easy 40 kills. if not more (titan mode) so far i come into matches and either im really good, or really lucky. Since most people have 0 kills, the most kills ive seen from another player so far is 30. Its an easy game. However, i will say the melee weapons are slightly op, your tactical items (grenades and what not) are nice, but not very useful at times. Sniper rifles and shotguns are basically the bottom of the barrel.
So nice graphics, gameplay, feel, gamemodes, music.
Not so good balance and or community (they dont seem to do a very good job or i just get alot of easy matches)
Could be people play pvp and not titan, works for me
Overall an 8/10 game, really love it. Its worth 10 dollars but on sale its a really good deal. I usually buy weapons and stuff from the market so its easy and fun.

reviewText: This game is awesome. If you like Section 8 or Section 8:Prejudice then you'll like this game. I call these types of game Startegy FPS b/c a slow human being with poor twitch relfexes can still be rewarded with plenty of kills and helping thier team win. For $9.99 this is an absolute steal, with at least 10 hours of play if you only think it's ok and at least 60 hours of play if you love it. Check out Section 8 and Section 8:Prejudice to get an idea of what this game is like. It was developed by the same studio (before they went bankrupt)

reviewText: I highly recommend this game for its mini-frag fests and unique art style. The guns and armor are fantastic, and gameplay is very smooth and intense. reviewText:
Hi dear reader.:)
I would like to talk about this game.
Im very mixed about this TPS(thir person shooter) voxel designed game.
I think its unfinished, lots of movement bugs, u can stock in nothing, or in a raptor or anithing in the map.
The optimization is ♥♥♥♥. My gaming rig is(i only list important things): AMD FX-8350, 2x sapphire HD7790 OC 2gb vram gddr5(crossfire) and 4gb ddr3 ram, and the game sometimes a little-bit choppy(its rare) but, the game don't have big graphics so its crazy.
My ping is always arround 24-40 and its sometime slooks like 100-200...its not good, i hope only i have this problem, and everybody play without any kind of lag.
I h8 cs:go because the micro transactions, you can buy skins and more skins for real money, the skins cool but if i paid X euro or dollar for a game, i don't want to see any microtransaction.
The level up system cool, u get cubes" and one cube=one weapon recipe

reviewText:
The servers were taken down for an indefinite time late 2015, due to reasons beyond the developer's control. The team has worked tirelessly to bring the game back into a playable state.

Before the game went down I spent a load of time on all 3 game modes. The combat is fluid and adaptable. Your character is responsive and agile. They are robust enough for new players to get into the game, but fragile enough that the element of suprise still plays a large factor in deciding who wins a 1 on 1 combat scenario.

One of the biggest criticisms of the game is that players using melee weapons are nearly invincible compared to other weapons. I've never had an instance where swords were decidedly unkillable, as mentioned in other reviews. Like any game, players need to adapt their playstyle to the weapon they use. Machine guns will not work well in cramped spaces. Likewise, swords are next to useless in wide spaces. Your weapon decides what lanes you take.

I have encountered two bugs, a texture error that does not affect gameplay whatsoever, and a leaderboard glitch that should be fixed with the new netcode the team is writing.

For me, the lack of gore is a huge bonus. I can play it with my young cousins without complaints from their parents.

When this game is playable again, I would recomend it to anyone looking for any type of non-military shooter.

reviewText:
Dont get me wrong, I love this game. As in I really really really love this game. The combat is so much fun, you can run all over the place committing mass genocide with a sword all the while jumping up and down really fun, multi-leveled maps.

The way this game has been handeled is absoultly repulsive. The servers have been down for god knows how long with little to no updates on when they will be back up. There were promisises of updates that never came, lag that is inherent of the game itself, and just a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ dev team in general.

My biggest conflict right now is pursuing a refund or holding onto the game untill I can play again. Suddenly a few people start giving it a thumbs down saying that the game is dead and it wont come back. reviewText:
Minimum is a really nice game. It's a third-person shooter with block styled graphics. A lot of people are sick of blocky games, but I think this one looks pretty great. The game is not very expensive but offers a lot of fun. But be aware, currently a lot of people are having issues launching and connecting to matches. If you get it you might not even be able to play it.

Even though the game left early access it's still as good as in beta. Lots of missing features, and still quite some issues. Still, I still think the game is worth it in its current state. It will only get better as the developers add new features and fix issues.

The current game has 3 modes, the main mode the game tries to focus on is the titan mode. You have to escort a giant robot trough the map, where it will fight the enemy's titan. Once a team's titan is destroyed, creeps will spawn. Players have to kill these creeps and collect their drops to make their next titan stronger. If a titan destroys the other team's titan, and manages to push forward enough, it will face a defensive wall covered by turrets. Once this wall is destroyed the current, and possible next titans won't have to deal with it again. The titan will face one more wall, and then get to the other team's base which will cause your team to win. Sounds pretty simple, but it's really fun.
Other modes are a simple team-deathmatch, and a co-op horde mode.

While playing you get to upgrade your weapons and armour by collecting drops you get from other players, the ground, minions or destroyed titans and walls. You will see the armor you buy appear on your character, and your weapon will become stronger and more awesome as you find upgrades for it. When you die however, your weapon resets to a lower level. While you get to keep your armour.

Every weapon and armour has its own stats, you have to unlock new ones with in-game materials you get by completing rounds and missions. Currently it's kind of grindy, but this might be fixed in the future.

The game does have microtransactions, but only for re-skins of free weapons and armour. These do give stats you'd have to grind for without paying, but it's not that bad really.

Overal the game is a nice little third-person shooter with a lot of fun features, and even more to come.

reviewText:
Alright, gotta be honest here, I've considered this one of the better games I've played, but it's got its own problems just like any other game..

It's got fantastic graphics despite being presented to you in only blocks. The hit animations, procs lighting, ambiance simply all fit too well together into one image. The map designs and the UI are extremely clean, very fitting to the modern style of 2 dementional shapes devoid of depth and complication.

The unique ingame level-ups are also very innovative and revolutionary, it brings tactics into play, thus promoting a whole new level of metagaming. Along with the flashy good looks. Your gameplay also changes as you progress through leveling your weapons, instead of the monotony presented in just about all other games, minimum presents fluidity. The game also offers you 6 loadouts you can customize right off the bat, and then swap around freely in battle, giving the players an incredible amount of flexibility.

Yes, competitive play is viable in minimum. Nothing's significantly better than any other thing, And kills arn't awarded to the best camper in town, but rather to who can control their character to their heart desires, and outplays their foes on an extensive level.

However... Its grasp extends beyond its reach, the game is simply too awesome to have such a fatal flaw. Which is quite a shame, but nonetheless fun. It simply can't hold a playerbase because the progression system is so poor to the point of none existent.  Level has no meanings other than a badge of dedication. All the items in you've so diligently worked for are worth nothing, as anynoob just starting off the game can easily purchase'em off the market for less than $5 in total. Nor is there an ELO rating or dedicated competitive games, which completely shuts off the competitive scene that should be but thriving as we speak. Because the skill spectrum in a typical match is so diverse, an experienced player would quickly get bored as he mows down the wave of charging newbies, whereas on the other hand, the new players would feel bashed upon. Leaving no fun for both parties.

New players would leave so quickly because they have to put up with the monotony upon reaching level 5, as there's probably acquired all the guns they found cool when starting off the game as the point of interest deminishes, the incent to keep playing lingers...

The game may appeal to retro gamers from quake back in the ol'days, where being skillful is all they need to have fun.. But however, times have changed. In our times, it's all about having and preserving a uniqueness that solely belongs to each individual player. In which case, you developers reading this should base your business model off of. A typical example would be CS:GO, or Blaclklight : Retribution (my favorite game). Because the quantity of their items (or skin) hast became astronomical, and the price range of them vary drastically from a few cents to maybe even over $1000. It keeps people attracted because we always want to work for something better than what they have, and the fact that there's almost always something better than what they have. If you make 10 different skins for each weapon, and each of them being 10 times more difficult to acquire than the latter.

The game also desecrates the point of having skins" for weapons and armor
recommended: a skin is meant to be unique
hoursPlayed: it's meant to be difficult / expensive to get as a trophy of dedication
voteText:
but no that didn't happen.



It may appeal to oldschool gamers."

reviewText:
This game ruled. Past tense. OR... more accurately, was going to rule.

As it stands now, this is a first rate third-person shooter with really good moba gameplay. It's really good!
The bots are scary smart (and will troll you in chat) making the need for real (human) opponents a secondary issue.

Prior to yesterday (see below) my only issue was the meh crafting system. There was going to be a weapon mod system, but it was replaced with a super generic list of purchasable (in game cash OR real money) weapon variants.

The game play was so good, that I was willing to wait for the Mod system to develop ( or even forego it completely), it's that good.

Yesterday, however, seemed to be the sounding of the death knell for Minimum. *a moment of silence, if you please*

They attempted to do some kind of login sync with steam that has locked its still-loyal players out of the game.

Emails to the devs are failing permanently, and a note thru the CONTACT US link in their Support" page has gone thus far
date:
ignored.

I give it till the wednesday after Memorial day before I uninstall and forget.

***I write this addendum 1 day before Memorial day***

The login issue has been resolved
recommended: and I can go back to loving this game in the sorry solitudenous company of foulmouthed bots with guns I cant get.\n\nI truly have great hopes for the future of this game. Here's hoping the devs can resolve the Mod / Crafting systems with the same great speed and thought that resolved the login thingy."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Picked up on impulse based on the aesthetic, alone.

As of right now only Titan mode is available but I don't have any problems with this, Titan mode seems like it would be my favorite even with more play modes available.  Titan mode has 2 teams of players doing battle at the feet of giant Titans.  As the Titans do battle one will die at the hands of the other and begin to march on the fallen Titans base, fighting its way through defensive walls and turret fire.  The team being attacked must focus on killing the Titan before it reaches their base and ends the round.  If both Titans are downed the game switches momentum toward the creep spawn" phase
date: where small NPC creatures begin to spawn around the edges of the map.  Kill the creeps to power up your Titan for the next Titan battle
recommended: keeping an eye out for the Golden Creep for extra power.\n\nThe game starts you out with 6 available loadout slots
hoursPlayed: and a basic arsenal consisting of a sword
voteText: assault rifle
helpfulPercent: shotgun
votesHelpful: sniper rifle
votesTotal: grenade
votesFunny: and deployable turret.  More weapon options open up almost immediately as you begin to play and spend currency earned in game (no pay to unlocks) to unlock and craft new weapons.  Weapons range from Titan killing giant swords to swords that heal your after a kill
commentsCount: to new versions of the sniper rifle and a few launcher weapons.\n\nOnce you've chosen your loadout and begin the match there is still some customization and and specialization to consider.  At any time during the match you can hit the M key and open the armor crafting menu.  Each round you start out as a naked block man
column16: completely capable of getting kills and winning the round
column17: only without the bonuses and negative effects that come with the armor sets.  Armor bonuses range from increased Titan damage
column18: ability to double jump
column19: increased run speed
column20: to increased damage and more.  Now that you've entered the match
column21: crafted a piece of armor
column22: and got a kill you can pick up the power orb dropped by the enemy
column23: evolving your weapon and increasing your power until you are killed.  For example
column24: if you are wielding the sword weapon and grab a power up orb
column25: you are now dual wielding swords and look like a bit of a badass.  Power it up further to wield two flame covered swords and strike fear in the hearts of anyone you can sneak up behind.\n\nSo
column30:
and defend your Titan until it's time to creep farm and make the final push on the enemy base!

I'm writing this review an hour before I leave for work and I can't wait to get home and play some more.
"

reviewText:
So you're telling me you built your server software on top of some proprietary middleware that your provider suddenly stopped running without warning, then it takes you 4 months to figure out how to get your account servers back running?

This started in September 2015 and now it's February 2016, the last dev update was from December 10th.

If this is the best you guys can do, you should consider hiring an actual software developer who will fart out the required backend services in node over the course of a few weeks. Shame, because the core game was kinda fun too. Alas, as this game proves, just because you know how to use UDK doesn't make you a programmer.
